conversation.content: Look, I got charged twice for the same feed order. Need this fixed.
Oh no, double charge. Let me pull that up. So what's your account number?
It's, uh... 4-7-2-8-9. March delivery.
Got it, account 47289. So basically I'm seeing two charges here on March 14th, both for $1,847.22. That's definitely not right. Let me check what happened with order FD-3847-ML.
Exactly. Same amount. Same day. I need one reversed today.
Absolutely. So here's what I'm doing right now. Processing refund for that duplicate charge, reference number RFN-9923-XK. Should hit your account in 2-3 business days.
Three days? I got payroll Friday. Need it faster.
Okay okay. Let me escalate this. So basically I'm marking this as priority expedited, case number PRI-6621. That cuts it to 24 hours max. We're going to fix this.
That works. This happen to other accounts?
So checking our system alerts... yeah, looks like batch 3847 had a processing glitch. Hit about 12 customers total. We caught most but yours slipped through.
Course it did. What about my next order? Due April 3rd.
So your April order, FD-4102-ML, that's all set. Single charge only, scheduled for delivery April 3rd to your location at 8827 County Road. And hey, I'm adding a credit for the hassle.
Credit? How much we talking?
So basically I'm applying $75 to your account right now. Credit code CRD-7734-AP. Plus I'm putting a note that you're priority customer status for the next 6 months.
Alright. That's... that's fair. But next time this happens, I'm switching suppliers.
Totally understand. So I'm personally flagging your account 47289 for manual review on all future charges. Nothing processes without human verification.
Good. And I want confirmation when that refund hits.
Already set. So you'll get email and text confirmation to the number ending in 3847 as soon as refund RFN-9923-XK processes. Like I'll personally make sure it goes through tomorrow.
Fine. Guess we're square then. For now.
We are. And so basically if anything feels off with future orders, you call and ask for me directly. Extension 4421. I've got your back on this.

scenario: cattle rancher, no-nonsense and wanting direct answers about a feed supplier charge
